clustering.old.kmeans
Class KMeans

java.lang.Object
  clustering.old.kmeans.KMeans

public final class KMeans
extends java.lang.Object

Pixel-based multi-band image segmentation using k-means clustering algorithm.

Author:
Jarek Sacha

Method Detail

run

public ij.process.ByteProcessor run(ij.ImageStack stack)
Perform k-means clustering of the input stack. Elements of the stack must be of type FloatProcessor.

Parameters:
stack - stack representing a multi-band image.
Returns:
segmented image.

getClusterCenters

public float[][] getClusterCenters()
Return location of cluster centers.

Returns:
array of cluster centers. First index refers to cluster number.

getClusterAnimation

public ij.ImageStack getClusterAnimation()
Return stack representing clustering optimization. This will return not null value only when configuration parameters clusterAnimationEnabled is set to true.

Returns:
stack representing cluster optimization, can return null.

getCentroidValueImage

public ij.ImageStack getCentroidValueImage()
Returns stack where discovered clusters can be represented by replacing pixel values in a cluster by the value of the centroid of that cluster.

Returns:
centroid value image

encodeSegmentedImage

private ij.process.ByteProcessor encodeSegmentedImage()
Find index of the cluster closest to the sample x. run(ij.ImageStack) must be run before calling this method.

Parameters:
x - test point, number of values must be the same is input stack size.
Returns:
index of the closest cluster.
See Also:
run(ij.ImageStack)

encodeCentroidValueImage

private ij.ImageStack encodeCentroidValueImage()

cluster

private void cluster()

initializeClusterCenters

private float[][] initializeClusterCenters()
Initialize clusters using k-means++ approach, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-means++

Returns:
initial cluster centers.
